avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is generally considered stable after thaw.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted in thaw. The remaining snow is mostly considered homogeneous and stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Older snow is generally considered stable. New thin wind slabs may form in the northern part of the country on Sunday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Older snow is generally considered stable. New thin wind slabs may form in the northern part of the country on Sunday.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA átt og dálítil væta á sunnudag, aðallega rigning en það gæti gránað í fjöll. Úrkomuminna á mánudag, norðanátt og kólnar. Dálítil él á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is mostly homogeneous and stable after thaw. New snow on Sunday evening and Monday may form unstable wind slabs.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Most of the snow is old, grainy and homogeneous. It has subsided and much melted. A little new snow was added in mountains of Thursday night 21.2. Snowfall is forecast on Sunday evening and Monday, and then new unstable wind slabs might form.

travelAdvisory.comment: Older snow is generally considered stable. New thin wind slabs may form in the northern part of the country on Sunday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Older snow is generally considered stable. New thin wind slabs may form in the northern part of the country on Sunday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvessir úr NA á sunnudag, með snjókomu til fjalla um kvöldið. Norðlæg átt á mánudag með snjókomu, hiti um frostmark á láglendi. Minni vindur og úrkoma á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Little snow came in easy E-winds on Thursday at higher elevations on top of the old firn and in easy W-winds with snowfall at higher elevations on Friday night. Stronger NE-winds on Sunday with snowfall

travelAdvisory.comment: Older snow is generally considered stable. New thin wind slabs may form in the northern part of the country on Sunday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Older snow is generally considered stable. New thin wind slabs may form in the northern part of the country on Sunday.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA-strekkingur síðdegis á sunnudag með slyddu eða rigningu í byggð, hægari N-NV læg átt á mán-þri með éljum

avalancheActivity.comment: Multiple thin avalanches released in Selárdalur in Norðfjörður on Saturday morning, 22.2. They all started at high elevations on steep slopes. They released in various aspects.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is mostly considered homogenous and stable. New snow high in mountains may be unstable at first.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Most of the snow is old, homogenous and stable. There is little snow left in the lower parts of slopes. On Friday 21.2, snow fell above approx. 500 m, but the new snow is expected to have settled in sunshine on Saturday 22.2. On Sunday, snow might fall at high elevations, but rain is expected at lower elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Older snow is generally considered stable. New thin wind slabs may form in the northern part of the country on Sunday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Older snow is generally considered stable. New thin wind slabs may form in the northern part of the country on Sunday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á sunnudag er spáð rigningu í austanátt, en snjókomu í hæstu fjöll. Úrkomulítið á mánudag og þriðjudag, kólnar.
